content:
Well I might have just freaked out a little bit... Got an email from one client site saying "Your version of Drupal is no longer supported." On the site in question the Update page says:

Drupal core 7.69
Project not supported: This project is no longer supported, and is no longer available for download. Disabling everything included by this project is strongly recommended!

But Drupal.org says 7.69 is still the recommended version of D7, so guessing this was just a glitch somewhere...

Drupal - Open Source CMS
Drupal - the leading open-source CMS for ambitious digital experiences that reach your audience across multiple channels. Because we all have different needs, Drupal allows you to create a unique space in a world of cookie-cutter solutions.
Indeed, refreshing the update page shows Drupal core is up-to-date.
Perhaps they've been doing test-runs in d.org ...in preparation for how people will react on Nov 2021 :laughter_tears:
That was a bug with semantic versioning: https://www.drupal.org/project/project/issues/3119831. But, yeah, that was irritating. :stuck_out_tongue_wink:
